column5: * Shares down 9 pct   (Adds shares  background  details from conference call)

column4: Time Inc cuts full-year revenue forecast for the second time
column5: Nov 4 Time Inc  publisher of Sports Illustrated  Time and People  cut its full-year revenue forecast for the second time as revenue from print advertising falls steadily.

column4: Toyota recalls 5 850 cars  mostly in U.S.  for possible steering issue
column5: DETROIT Toyota Motor Corp  said on Tuesday it is recalling about 5 850 cars  most of them in the United States  for possible loss of steering control.

column4: Toyota recalls 5 850 cars  mostly in U.S.  for possible steering issue
column5: DETROIT  Nov 4 Toyota Motor Corp said on Tuesday it is recalling about 5 850 cars  most of them in the United States  for possible loss of steering control.

column4: EU mergers and takeovers (Nov 4)
column5: BRUSSELS  Nov 4 The following are mergers under review by the European Commission and a brief guide to the EU merger process:

column4: TransCanada boosts Keystone XL cost nearly 50 percent to C$8 billion
column5: TransCanada Corp  Canada's No.2 pipeline company  on Tuesday raised estimated capital costs for its controversial Keystone XL project to C$8 billion ($7.02 billion) from an initial projection of C$5.4 billion  citing lengthy delays.

column4: UPDATE 2-TransCanada boosts Keystone XL cost nearly 50 pct to C$8 bln
column5: (Releads with pipeline cost estimates; adds CEO quote  background; updates share price)

column4: TransCanada's profit beats estimates
column5: Nov 4 TransCanada Corp   Canada's No.2 pipeline company  posted a better-than-expected third-quarter profit  helped higher earnings from its Keystone and Mexican pipelines.

column4: British spy chief demands more access to Twitter  Facebook to thwart attacks
column5: LONDON Twitter and Facebook are so important to militant groups that the technology giants should give security services greater access to their networks to allow governments to foil attacks  the head of Britain's eavesdropping agency said.

column4: U.S. court sets up Ackman  Valeant to vote at Allergan meeting
column5: A federal judge on Tuesday cleared the way for Pershing Square Capital Management and Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc to vote at an Allergan Inc shareholder meeting where they are seeking to remove six of nine Allergan board members as part of a hostile takeover attempt.

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. court sets up Ackman  Valeant to vote at Allergan meeting
column5: Nov 4 A federal judge on Tuesday cleared the way for Pershing Square Capital Management and Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc to vote at an Allergan Inc shareholder meeting where they are seeking to remove six of nine Allergan board members as part of a hostile takeover attempt.

column4: Court ruling leaves door open for Ackman to vote at Allergan meeting
column5: Nov 4 Pershing Square Capital Management and Valeant Pharmaceuticals International may be able to vote at a special meeting of Allergan shareholders in which they are seeking to remove 6 of 9 Allergan board members  a California court said on Tuesday  ruling partly for and partly against each side.

column4: BRIEF-U.S. judge won't halt Valeant  Pershing proxy votes on Allergan takeover  but requires more disclosures
column5: Nov 4   * U.S. judge orders Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  pershing

column4: UPDATE 2-MasterCard  Visa to cut fees for Canadian merchants  govt says
column5: TORONTO  Nov 4 Visa Inc and MasterCard Inc  voluntarily agreed to cut the fees they charge to Canadian retailers for credit transactions  the government said on Tuesday  adding it now sees no need to regulate fees set by credit card networks.

column4: Canada says Mastercard  Visa agree to cut fees
column5: TORONTO  Nov 4 Visa Inc and Mastercard Inc  have voluntarily agreed to cut the fees they charge to retailers for credit transactions  the Canadian government said on Tuesday  adding it now sees no need to regulate fees set by credit card networks.

column4: Visa to cut credit card interchange fees in Canada
column5: Nov 4 Visa Inc  the world's largest debit and credit card company  said it will cut average interchange fees in Canada to 1.50 percent on consumer credit cards.

column4: Disney's 'Big Hero 6' shapes superheroes from robotics and anime
column5: LOS ANGELES The newest Marvel superhero to reach the big screen does not have the rugged good looks of Iron Man  the muscular physique of Captain America or a cape and hammer like Thor.

column4: Disney cloud movie service adds Google Play purchases
column5: Walt Disney Co said its cloud-based movie service will expand to include purchases made through the Google Play online store  the latest in a string of moves by Hollywood studios to encourage digital ownership.

column4: Disney cloud movie service adds Google Play purchases
column5: Nov 3 Walt Disney Co said its cloud-based movie service will expand to include purchases made through the Google Play online store  the latest in a string of moves by Hollywood studios to encourage digital ownership.
